title: Colossal waist of time.. why??
text:
After reading all the poor reviews of this app I went ahead and decided to give it a try.

After I down loaded the app and went through the clunky process of registration then pairing (a lot of UI improvements needed here) I finally got to where I was supposed to connect to my home wireless, this is where I was presented with the â€œfree trialâ€ screen.. what a rip off!! After paying over a thousand bucks each for the washer and dryer I have to pay a monthly subscription to connect to mobile device!

title: This app does not work
text: How exactly did this app receive a 4.6 rating?  when all reviews all relates back to the same thing, THIS APP DOES NOT WORK!!! After installing this app and added my appliance and activated it via an email verification which I did with no problem, everything was fine UNTIL relaunching the app a message came up stating that terms and conditions were updated which I agreed to and press (next) in order to continue to operate my applianceâ€¦it did not work (are you surprised). No matter how many times I press (next) it went no further. So desperate to make this work I went to the earlier email verification that was sent in the initial setup and tried to do a reconfirm thinking it was glitch, and of course it came back with a message stating that my email address to this account have already been verified. So now I have this app and appliance that does not work with each other. I am not the type of person who feed on the negative and slander peopleâ€™s efforts, but I must say what would it have taken to see that the process actually worked for the general person looking to maximize the use of their appliance they spent good money for without the obvious frustration of an app that does not work. I would be stupid to ask if anyone tested this before release but,â€¦did anyone tested this before release? And based on the complaints did anyone even bothered to fix these issues or did you just see all the bad reviews and say â€œoh well itâ€™s not our problem anymore â€œ as I am sure based on the issues you should be able to pinpoint and fix this problem. It is unfair to the consumer to be led to think that the extra coins spent on a particular item would give them an advantage only to find out it would have been better to save those coins and get the regular stuff as this smartphone communication is nothing more than a marketing gimmick geared only to fleece the unsuspecting customer into thinking they have upgraded. Seriously you all need to do your job and deliver a product that actually works and stop delivering needless aggregation to customers.

title: Please bring the old app back
text: A week before the new version of the app was released, I was about the write a very positive review (4 stars), commending the app improving its quality and stability with kitchen appliances after several years of the opposite. The old version let you see each kitchen appliance and within one screen see the status and tap to toggle options like oven light, vent fan, etc. When cooking was done, you would get a push notification on your device with an option to stop cooking, keep the temp and continue cooking or set it to keep warm. Then the real powerful, under the radar feature was you could set up multi step cooking- broil for x minutes, then bake for y minutes, and keep warm for z minutes. This was awesome. Now in the new version all of that is nowhere to be found and I feel like whirlpool literally cheated me since I paid for my appliances expecting those feature to be available. Itâ€™s fine to pretty things up and modernize looks once and while but please donâ€™t do it at the expense of what makes something useful.

title: Could be so much more
text:
The app functions fine, but there are so many more things the developers could do. There are too many steps to remotely control an appliance and also too many restrictions. Wish I could start my dishwasher from any where at any time. Not keep pressing the remote button each time it is opened. Same with the microwave. Good ideas, but need to really start catching up with the remote control ideas in this generation if they want to remain relevant. Expected more.

Update: Moved to 4 star as I reinstalled the app and fixed some of the issues. I appreciate the company reaching out. Good customer service.

Still have to select remote control each time which is redundant and cumbersome, but I am liking my appliances more and more, each and everyday. Just bought a dryer as well. Now I have the smart dishwasher, microwave, and dryer. Looking forward to what updates software updates could bring.

title: Really disappointed
text:

Just found out my oven was on all night though the display on the oven vaguely indicated it was off (thereâ€™s no confirmation that is off you just have to guess). They brought the guessing game into the app as well, thereâ€™s no status indicator telling you the oven is on or off, it just says â€œready to cookâ€. One oven is on, the other off but they both show the same text. The app has this huge useless slide up thing that has static links to different blog posts on their site which would be fine if it didnâ€™t make you think it was there to control the appliance.

In addition, the remote start constantly disconnects, I have to reenable it on the oven(s) every few days. This problem also cascades to Alexa, which makes this feature useless since you canâ€™t actually remote start.

Finally I get to the controls for the oven(s), when you go to an appliance theyâ€™ve wasted the entire screen with a picture of an oven and give you one small terse button under something called â€œshortcutsâ€ that says â€œsee all oven featuresâ€. Just list them in all that extra space you used to show me what a oven looks like. 

Emphasis on their blog, nonexistent status indicators, and a lot of places to add appliances but not control them makes you think they donâ€™t actually want you to control the appliance from it.

However, in late November, early December, things got a lot better. Yummly support now functions as it should as does controlling the unit with Amazonâ€™s Alexa. I am glad I stuck it out and kept the the range. Best appliance purchase Iâ€™ve made in a long time.

title: Canâ€™t even log in

Having successfully registered using a desktop browser, I returned to the app and discovered that it wouldnâ€™t let me log in with that password. title: New interface/missing watch app
text:

title: I expected much more
text: The app functions and connects to my convection microwave, but thatâ€™s as much good as I can say for it. It has some bugs, including that the scan-to-cook feature often reports the microwave is in use when it is not. The microwave status shows â€œidleâ€ and pressing scan-to-cook just pops up a message saying the appliance is running. I have to then actually use the appliance to heat something, and at the end of that cycle, scan-to-cook will work. But it really doesnâ€™t matter because the scan-to-cook feature is nearly worthless anyway. Iâ€™ve scanned the entire contents of my freezer and found only 2 items that were recognized. Major national brands like Green Giant, Banquet, Marie Calendar, and TGI Fridayâ€™s were not recognized. The same was true for major retailerâ€™s house brands, like WalMart, Meier, and Kroger - none were recognized. But if all you have to heat are Boston Market or Lean Cuisine frozen entrees, those worked, so youâ€™re all set. The next time Iâ€™m at the store, Iâ€™m going to scan the pizza bites that Whirlpool shows in the demo video for scan-to-cook to see if they actually work, and my bet is that they will not be recognized. The app lets you enter cooking instructions manually and save them as a favorite, but this is obviously meant for ovens rather than microwaves as only whole minute increments are allowed. How about allowing the app to save a barcode, name it, and manually enter the cooking instructions including seconds if the library of supported brands is going to be so small? Better still, an interactive feature allowing users to upload their scanned items and cooking instructions to grow your library would be great.

title: Errors Errors and more Errors
text:
This application has never worked as advertised with the appliances. It took several months of trial and error just to connect the appliances to Wi-Fi. Lessons learned: you may need to use the WPS feature on your router to connect. Therefore the WPS feature on your router must be enabled through your router settings online. Secondly and even more technical, you may need to connect to your appliance IP through the Internet with a laptop or pc from your home network before you can connect via any mobile devices. Lastly it only works on 2.4 Wi-Fi. Your mobile device must be on the same channel. In summary Wi-Fi connection to your appliances using this app is far to technical and complicated for the average appliance owner. 

Only Minimal Wi-Fi features are functional. The application will not allow setting any of the appliance specific â€œpreferencesâ€ without returning the error code â€œError updating appliance preferences. Please try again laterâ€.... Later has come and gone over the past year. I have submitted several work orders with whirlpool that have only wasted my time without any resolution. Previous open tickets with Whirlpool tech support have been closed without resolving the issue. They did not attempt to contact me in regard to any of the open tickets they closed. 

Checking for software updates via this app will crash the application and you will need to force close the application. The software update seems to be unresponsive from the preferences menu. It just says loading for a few seconds and disappears without any update notices. When you go back one menu then the software update notice finally appears stating software is up to date. The â€œdismiss noticeâ€ radio button does nothing and the application becomes unresponsive (crashes). You must then force close the application and log back in. 

The Whirlpool tech support frequently fails to correctly identify these issues. So there can simply be no resolve if the issue is not accurately identified. I get an overwhelming perception that Whirlpool tech support Representatives simply donâ€™t care. This has been the case for several help tickets. Today I spoke with a Whirlpool representative again who failed to listen and continuously spoke over me with erroneous feedback and unskilled understanding of the problem. He eventually initiated an argument with me until I demanded to speak with a lead. The lead however was receptive and effectively documented the problem. 

These Wi-Fi appliances along with this application were chosen to improve the quality of life for a disabled Veteran with traumatic head injuries. He needs the advantages of Wi-Fi augmented devices to cook and clean however this defective application and the inability of Whirlpool to effectively and efficiently resolve systemic technical problems has become a real nightmare for this Veteran who has invested his savings of $6,000 on worthless mobile application enabled appliances. 

I would strongly advise looking elsewhere for applications and supported Wi-Fi enabled devices. Whirlpool Corp is clearly lagging far behind in this age of technology in that regard.

title: Doesnâ€™t Work With NETGEAR Orbi System
text:
12/12/18 Update:

Via another support session with Whirlpoolâ€™s IoT support staff, I can now report a successful connection between the microwave and the app. I was told their engineers changed some things on the back end.

I would still insist that the setup requirement that both the phone and appliance are on the same 2.4GHz network is absurd. Many new routers support both bands, and thereâ€™s no way to tell an iPhone â€œ...connect only to 2.4GHz WiFi...â€ I get it that the appliance is limited to using only 2.4GHz WiFi, but it shouldnâ€™t matter what frequency band the iPhone is using, as long as they are both on the same network.

Developers should look at the setup process for a TP-Link Kasa smart WiFi plug. I set one up yesterday with the smart plug on the 2.4GHz band and my phone on the 5GHz band, and the setup process was quick and painless.

All the above being said, Iâ€™m revising my rating of this app from 1 star to 2.

We are now at the 6 month point since I first tried to connect our microwave, and several sessions with Whirlpoolâ€™s IoT support team have failed to resolve the issue.

Our Orbi system provides WiFi over 2 frequencies, 2.4GHz and 5GHz, acting as one network with one SSID. The setup calls for both the mobile device and microwave to be on the same 2.4GHz network. 

I donâ€™t know if this is true with Android phones or not, but it isnâ€™t possible in iOS to select a specific frequency band...my iPhone will always connect to the 5GHz band.

So thatâ€™s a problem right away!

Help from NETGEAR showed me how to temporarily turn off the 5GHz band, and I tried this during one of the support sessions with Whirlpool, but Iâ€™m still not able to connect the phone to the microwave â€˜s network.

So Iâ€™m stuck with an appliance that connects to my WiFi just fine, but wonâ€™t connect to my phone....rendering the WiFi connection completely useless.

Buyer beware.

title: Had to replace oven
text:
I would have given less than one star if it were possible.  This software did not work. It damaged the oven beyond repair, so we had to replace it.  My recommendation is to not use the software.  It is possibly safer to just use the manual controls.

Update 12/02/18:

We got a new oven from Whirlpool.  The oven works, but I have given up using the app.  The app is poorly made, it is counter intuitive.  I certainly do not trust the app to control the function of the oven.  Further, the oven is continuously disconnecting itself from the WiFi.  This seem to be the first generation of â€œsmartâ€ appliances.  My recommendation is to stay away from â€œsmartâ€ appliances till they are more reliable.

title: Very poorly done

title: Oven Does Not Connect To App
text:
I went through every connection method available (scan the QR code, find network manually, use WPS to connect) and my app simply wonâ€™t connect to the oven. I called customer service, and after 2 hours of them having me do everything I did on my own, they told me they see my appliance connected to my router but couldnâ€™t do anything for me.
